intro: Phacelia cottamii, commonly known as Cottam's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
